page.title: 01The survey area
page.content:
The area is 9 miles North East of Salisbury on the edge of Salisbury Plain. It is chalky downland devoted almost entirely to farming which explains the nature of our report.
The area includes the southern side of the hamlet of Winterbourne Stoke,which is situated on the A303 trunk road between London and Exeter. Also the village of Berwick St.James which has 149 adults on the electoral roll.
The river Till runs through both villages.In Winterbourne Stoke, the river is a true winter bourne (stream), only rising above ground with the winter rains, but in Berwick it is fed throughout the year by springs.
